channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 6 dead in Rwanda due to Marburg outbreak: All you need to know about the deadly virus
item.description: Six people in Rwanda, primarily medical professionals, have died from the Marburg virus since the outbreak was declared. This highly fatal disease, related to Ebola, has seen twenty cases so far. It spreads through contact with bodily fluids of infected individuals and causes severe hemorrhagic fever with a high mortality rate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Helene’s fury leaves Florida town in ruins: ‘It’s never been this bad’
item.description: Steinhatchee on Florida’s Gulf Coast faced severe damage from Hurricane Helene, which brought 140 mph winds and a 10-foot storm surge. Most of the town's residents evacuated and returned to find their homes and businesses destroyed. Restoration efforts have begun, but recovery will take weeks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sunak on way out? Focus on Indian visas as Tories mull leadership change
item.description: The contest to replace Rishi Sunak as Conservative leader intensifies, with immigration at the forefront. Leading candidates Robert Jenrick and Kemi Badenoch push for stricter Indian visa rules and stress cultural integration. The Conservative Party conference in Birmingham will be pivotal as candidates present their visions ahead of the final vote on November 2.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Track and field star Shelby Daniele dies at age 23
item.description: Shelby Daniele, a 23-year-old standout track and field athlete from Cal Poly, has passed away. Known for both academic excellence and athletic achievements, she earned numerous accolades during her time with the Mustangs. The university community mourns her loss, remembering her as a role model who cared deeply for those around her.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Staff left 'shocked' as Florida surgeon mistakenly removes liver instead of spleen, leading to fatality
item.description: A Florida doctor's medical licence was suspended after he mistakenly removed a patient's liver instead of the spleen, resulting in the immediate death of a 70-year-old man. The doctor is accused of falsifying medical records to cover up his error. This incident occurred at Ascension Sacred Heart Emerald Coast Hospital in August.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Austrians vote with far right in sight of historic win
item.description: Austrians participated in a general election where the far-right Freedom Party could potentially secure a historic win over the conservatives. Under Herbert Kickl's leadership, the party has surged in popularity due to voter concerns about migration and inflation. The ruling conservative People's Party, led by Chancellor Karl Nehammer, remains close in the polls.

item.title: Climate change, harsh weather in France bring challenges to Chablis wine country
item.description: The Domaine Roland Lavantureux winery in Chablis experienced a difficult 2024 harvest due to extreme weather conditions like frost, hail, and heavy rain. These factors led to significant crop losses and a lower yield of Chardonnay grapes. Winemakers are now adopting new strategies to adapt to the changing climate and protect their vineyards.

item.title: More than 20 Hezbollah members killed alongside Nasrallah, says Israel: Top developments
item.description: The Israeli military confirmed that an airstrike in Beirut killed Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah and over 20 other members. The attack targeted underground headquarters beneath civilian buildings. This has led to heightened tensions, with Iran calling for a UN Security Council meeting to discuss Israel's recent actions in Lebanon.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why a mom of 2 is busy planning her own funeral
item.description: Erika Diarte-Carr, a 33-year-old mother from Utah, faces a terminal diagnosis of Stage 4 small cell lung carcinoma and Cushing Syndrome. With just three months left, she has raised over $840,000 through GoFundMe for her children's future. Erika plans to spend her remaining time creating lasting memories with her kids.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tip from mole triggered high-stakes op to eliminate Hezbollah chief: Report
item.description: Hezbollah chief Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah was killed in an Israeli airstrike on his underground headquarters in Beirut, following intelligence from an Iranian mole. This operation represents a significant blow to Hezbollah amid heightened conflict with Israel, resulting in substantial casualties on both sides.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China calls on all parties, 'especially Israel', to deescalate tensions after Nasrallah's killing
item.description: China has urged Israel and other involved parties to take immediate steps to reduce tensions following the killing of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah in an Israeli bombing. The Chinese Foreign Ministry expressed deep concern over the escalating conflict and advised its citizens against traveling to Lebanon, condemning actions that exacerbate regional tensions.

item.title: Russia claims to down over 100 Ukrainian drones amid widespread barrages; fires break out across regions
item.description: Russian officials stated that more than 100 Ukrainian drones were intercepted on Sunday, leading to wildfires and damage to buildings, with Volgograd facing the heaviest assault. Meanwhile, Russian airstrikes injured 13 civilians in Zaporizhzhia, Ukraine. Both nations are experiencing substantial drone and aerial attacks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Trump tosses popcorn at stadium crowd that chants 'USA' on his entry
item.description: Donald Trump attended the Alabama vs Georgia football game, greeted by cheering supporters and tossing popcorn boxes to them. He watched from a luxury box after delivering a campaign speech in Wisconsin where he criticized Vice President Kamala Harris over her handling of the migrant crisis, suggesting she should resign or be impeached.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Outrage erupts over Nazi-era song sung at Austrian funeral
item.description: A Vienna funeral featuring a song with Nazi-era connections has ignited controversy as Austria heads into elections favoring the far-right. Three Freedom Party politicians were present, prompting widespread condemnation from other political parties. The Jewish Students' Union reported the incident to prosecutors, highlighting concerns over rising extremism.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'You wake up and the life you know is just gone': Residents share challenges as Hurricane Helene claims 63 lives
item.description: Storm Helene has left a trail of devastation across the Southeastern United States, killing at least 64 people and causing widespread power outages. Rescuers are facing immense challenges in their search for survivors. The storm has caused significant damage to homes and infrastructure, with residents showing resilience in the face of adversity.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who was Nabil Kaouk, top Hezbollah commandar killed by Israel
item.description: Israel has killed Nabil Kaouk, a senior Hezbollah commander, in an airstrike following the death of leader Hassan Nasrallah. Kaouk served as deputy head of Hezbollah’s Central Council and was involved in military operations since the 1980s. Israel has increased its attacks on Hezbollah targets recently, including communication systems and various locations across Lebanon.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Virginia jury awards $300 million to women alleging sexual abuse at children's hospital
item.description: A Richmond jury has awarded a total of $300 million to three women who alleged sexual abuse while patients at Cumberland Hospital for Children and Adolescents in Virginia. Each woman was granted $60 million in compensatory damages and $40 million in punitive damages. This case marks the first of many lawsuits against the hospital and Dr. Daniel Davidow.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Drake Hogestyn, beloved 'Days of Our Lives' star, passes away at 70
item.description: Drake Hogestyn, best known for his role as John Black on Days of Our Lives, has passed away at age 70. Initially pursuing baseball, he switched to acting following an injury. His portrayal of John Black won him many fans. He succumbed to pancreatic cancer after a brave fight.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pope Francis vows to support clergy sexual abuse victims during Belgium visit
item.description: Pope Francis visited Belgium and pledged support for victims of clergy sexual abuse, committing to offer assistance after meeting with survivors seeking compensation. His visit drew criticism from King Philippe and Prime Minister Alexander De Croo, who highlighted the Church's delayed response in addressing the abuses that have shaken the institution for years.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Italy's Monreale Cathedral's stunning mosaics regain golden lustre
